org.libgit2.jagged

Class Repository

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.libgit2.jagged.Repository

  • public class Repository
extends Object
    A Repository is the primary interface to a git repository.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Repository(String path)
      Open an existing on-disk git repository.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Repository clone(String sourceUrl, String path)
      Clone an existing git repository to a local repository.
      void dispose()
      Disposes the underlying Repository object.
      Branch getHead()
      Gets the branch of this repository pointed to by HEAD.
      ReferenceCollection getReferences()
      Enumerate the references for this repository.
      static Repository init(String path)
      Create a new on-disk git repository.
      static Repository init(String path, boolean bare)
      Create a new on-disk git repository.
      boolean isBare()
      Queries whether this repository is a "bare" repository, once that lacks a working directory.
      <T extends GitObject> 
      T      		 lookup(ObjectId id)
      Looks up and returns the given object from the repository by id.
      <T extends GitObject> 
      T      		 lookup(ObjectId id, ObjectType type)
      Looks up and returns the given object from the repository by id.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Repository

        public Repository(String path)
        Open an existing on-disk git repository. The returned Repository must be dispose()d.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to a repository or a working directory

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static Repository init(String path)
        Create a new on-disk git repository. The returned Repository must be dispose()d.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the new git repository (for bare repositories) or working directory (for non-bare)
        Returns:
        the new Repository

      • init

        public static Repository init(String path,
              boolean bare)
        Create a new on-disk git repository. The returned Repository must be dispose()d.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the new git repository (for bare repositories) or working directory (for non-bare)
        bare - true if the new repository should be a "bare" repository (lacking a working directory), false otherwise
        Returns:
        the new Repository

      • clone

        public static Repository clone(String sourceUrl,
               String path)
        Clone an existing git repository to a local repository. The returned Repository must be dispose()d.
        Parameters:
        sourceUrl - the path to the existing git repository
        path - the path to the new repository working directory
        Returns:
        the new Repository

      • isBare

        public boolean isBare()
        Queries whether this repository is a "bare" repository, once that lacks a working directory.
        Returns:
        true if the given repository is bare, false otherwise

      • getReferences

        public ReferenceCollection getReferences()
        Enumerate the references for this repository.
        Returns:
        a collection of references for this repository

      • lookup

        public <T extends GitObject> T lookup(ObjectId id)
        Looks up and returns the given object from the repository by id.
        Parameters:
        id - the object id to query (not null)
        Returns:
        the git object

      • lookup

        public <T extends GitObject> T lookup(ObjectId id,
                             ObjectType type)
        Looks up and returns the given object from the repository by id.
        Parameters:
        id - the object id to query (not null)
        type - the type of object to query (not null)
        Returns:
        the git object

      • getHead

        public Branch getHead()
        Gets the branch of this repository pointed to by HEAD.
        Returns:
        the branch pointed to by HEAD

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes the underlying Repository object.
